{"step_by_step_thinking": "Parkinson's disease is a neurodegenerative disorder that affects predominately dopamine-producing neurons in a specific area of the brain. Symptoms develop slowly over years, and among them, there are also oral health problems. However, Parkinson's disease does not directly affect the arrangement of teeth. The arrangement of teeth is determined by genetics and not by neurological conditions. Therefore, in a Parkinsonism patient, the teeth arrangement would be the same as in any other person without the disease.", "answer_choice": "A. Anatomic"}
